title: Will technology actually replace humans at all jobs one day? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. By then though, we’d reach a stage in which none of us have to work in order to survive. We’d let the machine do the work for us while we play and do whatever we want. That is if there isn’t a group of elite that monopolize everything to gain power. Honestly speaking, if the whole world pull together right now and work together to raise the standard of living, no one in this world will be living in poverty. It’s because there are people out there who hog all the resource and build systems to keep them in power that we aren’t able to do that. Fact, it’s not because we’re incapable of understanding each other that we don’t understand each other. It’s because we refuse to understand each other that we don’t understand each other. It’s not because we’re incapable of achieving world peace that we don’t have world peace. It’s because we choose not to have world peace that we don’t have it. People keep blaming on factors like scarcity and all the BS but at the end of the day, the fault lies within us. It’s just that no one wants to admit it. Over the course of my life among humanity, I learn that it is hard to save a species that doesn’t want to be saved.

Once a job is automated, it is worth almost nothing. Think about translating a computer language into a machine language. In the 1960s, that might have been a valuable job, but now a compiler does that automatically. It’s worth maybe 10 cents for the electricity. If you had someone come to your home and wash the dishes every day, what would you pay? You might have to pay between $2000 and $8000 per year for that service, right? How much would you pay to your dishwasher machine? Well, you do pay for the electricity, but that’s probably worth about $60 to $80 per year. Essentially, that “job” became completely worthless. So, no one would wash dishes by hand in our current society. Take a look at the Tesla factory. How many people are working on that assembly line? Not many, right? We’ve lost 50,000 factories to China because the Chinese can do the work for less than Americans. The thing to keep in mind is that if those jobs hadn’t gone to another country, they would have been automated away. Things would have been pretty much the same as they are in any case. Even though most jobs have already been automated away, we live in a society where both spouses typically work full-time and barely make enough to make ends meet. In fact, many people have to work multiple jobs. Have jobs been eliminated and we all relax on the beach? No.
